Section.Catchline: Conditions for invalidation of a consent to adoption or affidavit of nonpaternity.

SectionBody.Text: Notwithstanding the requirements of this chapter, a failure to meet any of those requirements does not constitute grounds for invalidation of a consent to adoption or revocation of an affidavit of nonpaternity unless the extent and circumstances of such a failure result in a material failure of fundamental fairness in the administration of due process, or the failure constitutes or contributes to fraud or duress in obtaining a consent to adoption or affidavit of nonpaternity.

Note.Text: The words “withdrawal of” were stricken by s. 26, ch. 2012-81; the word “of” was reinserted by the editors to provide clarity.
